alert.note: Alert for Carver; Scott; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 11:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Carver, Scott and Sibley Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns, Sherburne and Wright Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Up to a half-inch of additional rainfall through Friday morning is expected to prolong high river flows through the end of this week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River near Jordan. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.5 feet, Highway 41 at Chaska may close when the river reaches this stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 945 AM CDT Thursday, the stage was 25.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 945 AM CDT Thursday was 25.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 28.7 feet Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.3 feet on 04/16/1952. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
